data.text: I am currently live on @RadioHumberside for the next hour - listen in! https://t.co/td88BkKY1c
Today's decision to give Huawei access to our 5G network is a mistake. https://t.co/fXcIAEK1QW

Forecasters are now beginning to recognise the value of having a clear Brexit strategy. 
https://t.co/3fYh3OAqWF

This is certainly worth a look. Leading in standards, but without making them protectionist, is an attractive strategy. 
https://t.co/XB3euqy1cC

There is no doubt that the United States has sometimes been heavy handed in their dealings with the Chinese. But on Huawei I think they have a point. We need to review our decision on this. 
https://t.co/j2Uy4M2xlh
Cancellation of HS2 would save well over £150 million per constituency, and could pay for over 200 hospitals!
The wise and brave decision in the national interest is the cancellation of HS2 and replacement with projects that will deliver in the short & medium term, of which there are vast numbers.

Just how many more of these warnings do we need? HS2 is a totally unacceptable use of taxpayers' money. We must scrap it now and refocus our spending on local infrastructure projects. I am still of the view the cost will be closer to £200bn than £100bn.

https://t.co/SBkkhwkZTx
RT @DavidDavisMP: In June last year, I sought undertakings from the @ukhomeoffice that new regulations would be brought forward on facial r…

In June last year, I sought undertakings from the @ukhomeoffice that new regulations would be brought forward on facial recognition. I got the following response. I can't see how today's news can be compatible with this answer. https://t.co/SbhJgLn02v
This is unwise. https://t.co/y8LcLgU02p

I have urged the Home Secretary to delay the extradition of Mike Lynch until his UK civil trial has finished. In the long term, we need to re-balance our extradition treaty with the US. We need to give British citizens the protection, certainty and the justice that they deserve. https://t.co/fm1Mklq5f2

Today I urged the Government to find a compromise with Lord Mackay on his amendment to the Withdrawal Act. While we must end the ECJ's jurisdiction after Brexit, it should be for Parliament or the higher courts to amend legacy regulations, not lower courts. https://t.co/v58iIEhAOL

Voltaire said, "I may detest what you believe, but I'll defend till death your right to say it". Grouping Greenpeace and PETA with organisations in the anti-terror list in the Prevent strategy, runs the risk of undermining free speech. https://t.co/1etTL3nzcj

Under changes to Vehicle Excise Duty, owners of new motorhomes face a 705% tax hike. This unjust increase, masquerading as a green policy, risks the jobs of many of my constituents and must be reversed. https://t.co/2M409llWCv

This story was first published yesterday in @thesundaytimes: 
https://t.co/5nt2Yvi9qG

The improper release of the data of 28 million students and school children to gambling companies is very concerning. Fines for these data breaches are often factored into the cost of business. So I hope on this occasion the @ICOnews fine is many multiples of the profits made. https://t.co/yYL3Aq9UPX

£106bn is unlikely to be the final figure for HS2. This white elephant must be scrapped so we can invest in regional infrastructure projects, which will provide greater benefits for all. 
https://t.co/QeVdplGEAK

We need to take a sensible approach to historical investigations of killings during the Troubles. Allowing vexatious and politically motivated claims against soldiers who have acted with honour is not good enough. 
https://t.co/uk62bUmf5V
At this morning's meeting, I also had the pleasure of meeting with some of the incredibly talented apprentices @BAESystemsplc has at its Brough site. https://t.co/B9Apl0ExEo

This morning I had a constructive meeting with the CEO of @BAESystemsplc. It was agreed that BAE would look again at plans to end manufacturing at their Brough site. This is promising news for the many highly skilled employees of BAE in the area.

.@RobertBuckland was very careful in his answers on @SkyNews about extradition arrangements with the US. I suspect he is aware of the extremely controversial case of Dr Mike Lynch where there is another risk of our US Extradition Treaty leading to another miscarriage of justice.

Properly decent treatment of these children is a priority. It cannot be beyond a state like ours to bring back - and control - the mothers in order to secure the safety of these children. https://t.co/g46EkZE9Iv

Here is my full contribution to today's Queen's Speech Debate: 
https://t.co/yryQY3NMrq

Brexit will not be the biggest challenge of this decade. Globalisation of trade and new technology present huge challenges and opportunities. To grasp these we must focus on boosting productivity so we can invest in public services and increase people's opportunities and income. https://t.co/7LgqAJbJUf

The review of the Loan Charge resulted in a misguided attempt at a compromise. It is vital the Government deals with this in a principled manner and cancels Loan Charge taxes prior to the putative retrospective legislation of 2017.  

https://t.co/0eUUmuyqOk
Congratulations to @cmackinlay. Today marks the one year anniversary of him being completely exonerated of allegations from the 2015 election.

I welcome the announcement of a review into IR35. But letting the implementation of IR35 go ahead during the review will seriously cost people and small businesses. It would be more sensible to defer implementation until  2021.

Interesting response from @JulianSmithUK on the cost of the Loughinisland investigation. Press freedom was attacked and the civil rights of journalists were abandoned at a cost of £113,000. Good reason for a full public apology from the Chief Constable. 

https://t.co/39pfomyA8z
Congratulations to my Parliamentary neighbour @EmmaHardyMP on her new appointment. It is always a pleasure to work alongside Emma to fight on behalf of our constituents. https://t.co/s3Oykj0ss5
This is the reply from @StewartMcDonald. https://t.co/GskUpMsMgJ
When we find ourselves in tense international periods, we should consider the power and oversight of our armed forces. Here are some of my thoughts. https://t.co/hEn36gSR1T
3. Based on these points, the proper break point should be 2017, not 2010, which seems like a compromise pulled out of thin air.
2. The review also said that 2017 legislation's retrospective elements were completely without legal precedent.
1. Sir Amyas Morse's report raises the point that the Treasury was still losing significant test cases up to 2015 and it was only resolved by the Supreme Court in 2017.
I couldn't get into Treasury Questions to ask @Jesse_Norman about the Loan Charge today. These are the points I would have made:

Astonishing article about the HS2 review by Lord Berkeley in The Sunday @Telegraph. Reinforces the view that HS2 been economically unviable for some time. It needs to be cancelled now and the money spent on smaller more useful transport projects.
https://t.co/4VGXeXSCVb

Since the financial crash, productivity has flat lined. Today's Queen's Speech & our majority has the ability to revive this. We need to treble R&D investment, encourage successes like the @TheAMRC and focus on Wales, the Midlands and the North.

https://t.co/Up1HocdAJe

Today I have written to @sajidjavid urging him to immediately publish the independent review into the Loan Charge and to suspend the payment deadline of 31 January. I will continue fighting this retrospective and unjust tax on behalf of my constituents. https://t.co/IHPXsH4zUk
RT @ConHome: From @DavidDavisMP: How to keep the new working class voters we won last Thursday – and win even more https://t.co/CxSnv3lX8i

If you would like to the listen to the full discussion it is available here: 
https://t.co/fs7bk9MvFk
Today, I appeared on @BBCr4today discussing what the new @Conservatives majority means for our continued Brexit negotiations and the future of the UK. https://t.co/bwLkyInZBa
Congratulations to @paulbristow79. It was clear he was going to win when we went to help him on his excellent campaign in Peterborough.

Really extraordinary nonsense from a BBC that has got Brexit wrong at every turn now trying to conclude that a big Tory victory means a more Euro-compliant negotiation! They forget that Boris actually believes in Brexit.
Thank you, @LiamEYorks ! My constituents in Haltemprice and Howden will always be my top priority. https://t.co/Xk0FWTQeTH
Only three days to go until polling day! I met with my team tonight over a pizza or three ahead of our final push. https://t.co/Rm5MBDt3Hh
Excellent and productive meeting with members of the Yorkshire @NFUtweets https://t.co/62S0ArJSp4
Great morning at Elloughton Christmas Tree Festival and meeting Ruby and Dixie! https://t.co/nb2OASXnhT
Meet Coco, the dog of the day. https://t.co/c7sDywElcI
RT @JasonMcCartney: Great to have David Davis join #TeamJason in Holme Valley today - huge surge in support as we’re picking up even more e…
Hardly surprising, he was a brilliant MP!
Labour rattled in Colne Valley. Really good reaction on doorsteps to @JasonMcCartney
I would also suggest a read of @AnthonySeldon's book on this subject! https://t.co/zpM1UgA8hI

Technologies and platforms such as @priyalakhani's https://t.co/dD5JTL2Btd are extremely interesting, and have the potential to dramatically improve the performance of pupils of all abilities while aiding teachers with analysis and workload.

Despite some decent, recent improvements, we are still underachieving in educational achievement in the PISA scores. Over and above the government's sensible reforms, we need to look hard at using modern tech to help teachers. https://t.co/heTiBbMMK8
I would call it the British bulldog spirit, but unfortunately this one was a French bulldog! https://t.co/SVcnmeoIx8
A hideous harbinger of the future if we are not careful. https://t.co/Ene2U1Xrsw
I wrote about this today on Conservative Home. https://t.co/R89LNWV2v1

Whilst the ECHR has an important role in dealing with terrorism, MPs must have the final say on determining the law.  Independent courts, national or international, are enormously important - but we should recognise that they do make mistakes, as with Usman Khan.

Legal wrangling continues in the case brought by Loughinisland journalists Barry McCaffrey and Trevor Birney. Hopefully we'll have a decision soon.
https://t.co/BihVzHNdxi
Police seem to have reacted with impressive speed to the London Bridge incident. As they did last time.
I couldn’t agree more. The whole Humber catchment area needs a new Vermuyden to find smart, innovative solutions to flood management
The Drainage Association has written to party leaders today calling for a “strategic catchment-based approach that considers wider benefits other than just ‘counting chimney pots.’”
@Marinosloizides also met some four-legged constituents🐾 https://t.co/8Z9zciU1DM

Had an excellent but rather wet day out in Brough. 

I met a number of my constituents who I have helped over the years, like @Marinosloizides. https://t.co/ItjIXQCdQM

RT @andreajenkyns: Another great day on the doorsteps talking to residents across #Morley & #Outwood 🚪🗳

Special thanks to the fantastic Ha…

I don’t normally take it upon myself to highlight the bogus “facts” in @LibDems leaflets. But in this case it is quite important that nobody believes the one at the end of this leaflet! 

Just to be clear, the General Election is on Thursday 12 December, NOT Monday 2 December. https://t.co/gCqqVImqTv
The Haltemprice and Howden team had a great day out supporting @andreajenkyns. The response on the doorstep was fantastic. https://t.co/SxVmVj4wpe

Many congratulations to @HitachiRailEU  and @Hull_Trains  on the arrival of the new Paragon Fleet. It is terrific to see this level of investment in our railways. I'm looking forward to my next trip, it will be great to have a train as nice as the staff. https://t.co/JH8ltNwxy7

Took some of the team to Grimsby yesterday for a wet day’s campaigning. Was originally sceptical of the poll that gave us a 12 point lead there.  Not any more. Virtually everybody I spoke to was voting Conservative. https://t.co/rn6kWu9a0R
Guidance by the College of Policing needs immediate revision. Police should not be investigating “non-crimes”.  Positively Orwellian.

Well worth reading Zoe Strimpel's article about oppression of free speech and ridiculous behaviour by various police forces, including my own, Humberside.

https://t.co/v7djGlXuFE

Really good interview of @CatharineHoey in today's Telegraph. Highlights her courage.

https://t.co/BlAiZypXzf
The Chief Executive of @resfoundation confirming that under Labour manifesto commitments, taxes would have to rise on the bottom 95% of earners. https://t.co/Ap6xNh98Yo
RT @DominicRaab: I am relieved a number of orphaned children have arrived home safely from Syria. We assess each case carefully, and facili…

Good article in today’s Times on how Corbyn’s tax hikes do not bear scrutiny, by @PJTheEconomist - director of the independent thinktank @TheIFS.
https://t.co/TcJlpibbB9

.@jeremycorbyn claims that his taxes will fall solely on the rich. In the last week a number of my working class constituents have spontaneously said that they believe his taxes will hit them. After yesterday they have been proven right.

Excellent news about the return of the orphans. @DominicRaab is right that these children are innocent of any crime. But so are all the other British children in Syrian camps; we should bring these home too, ASAP, before there are any more deaths. https://t.co/7CHuFotO03

The US’ extradition request for Dr Mike Lynch comes at an extraordinarily inappropriate time, as a verdict has yet to be reached in the civil case he is fighting here in the UK. The British authorities should not countenance extradition at this time. 
https://t.co/2OVQkcLQbz

In Cottingham Market, with my team - just met someone who wants us to do something about the unjust and retrospective loan charge. I hope we will deal with this shortly after the election. https://t.co/RCVjLHEy9D

Labour are very unwise to pledge to scrap right to buy. It’s the most popular policy with working families. It would not release any new houses because the vast majority of council tenants stay in their house for a long period. https://t.co/kMlsqrtegT

Today, I met with Community Speed Watch Bubwith who monitor traffic through the village, which is plagued with dangerous speeding vehicles. They work alongside the police, who send warnings to any offenders. This is a great community-led initiative that I am proud to have helped. https://t.co/kr9F4JYaDw
.@JeremyCorbyn says corporation tax rates back to 2010 levels. We raised over 10 billion less in 2010 than we do now.
Good one-liner from @BorisJohnson Boris on social care. Nobody should have to sell their home to pay for their care.
.@jeremycorbyn is ignoring the simple fact that Labour, under Blair, introduced more private sector involvement in the NHS than any other government.
RT @DavidDavisMP: .@jeremycorbyn's attempt to suggest we seek to privatise the NHS fails completely before the Prime Minister's flat denial…
RT @BorisJohnson: Our NHS will never be for sale. #BackBoris #LeadersDebate
.@jeremycorbyn's attempt to suggest we seek to privatise the NHS fails completely before the Prime Minister's flat denial. It's that simple.
.@jeremycorbyn Corbyn claims we got our deal through with the DUP's support - this is wrong, it passed second reading WITHOUT the DUP. #LeadersDebate

Great news that Boris intends to cut employers’ NI and some other taxes. The main effect will be on small companies who create more of the jobs and more of the growth in the economy than the big companies do.  
https://t.co/Z2K8Ry3OO9
Brilliant article by @LiamHalligan in the Telegraph. His new book "Home Truths" looks well worth a read - very similar to my own views and ideas on garden villages. https://t.co/YOgIvtspV7
Secondly, I am not aware of other countries with an FTA, like Japan or Korea, paying for access!

.@jeremycorbyn said “If you want access to a market there are costs involved” in answer to a question about whether we should continue to pay an EU subscription. Firstly, their access to our market is bigger than ours to them - so why should we pay?
@RobOz73 Thanks Rob, I appreciate you letting me know. Would you mind shooting me a brief email to campaign@daviddavis.uk with this info in so I can investigate?

We now have to learn the lessons and make the emergency measures unnecessary. Would you do me a favour, @RobOz73, and brief your local councillors on the detailed causes? I will be pursuing all of these issues with the local authorities when we have the data to review. Thanks.
Thanks Rob - the local services did a magnificent job in numerous places, as I saw for myself at Everthorpe. I am very, very glad they saved your house. https://t.co/KDOVQIdBXh

Quick update: as far as I can tell, about 18 houses flooded this week. That is 18 too many, as it is absolutely miserable for families. But it looks likely that the combination of millions spent on flood defences and the efforts of local authorities saved thousands more houses. https://t.co/akzJRz2cAk

I also visited the Market Weighton canal. By Murphy's law, the canal's lock had a problem only a couple of weeks ago. But local drainage specialists fixed it just in time, protecting a vast area of East Yorkshire from high tides. https://t.co/bEpEksspXX

Today I was up at the lagoon at Willerby Carr to inspect the flood defenses there. The lagoon is full, and has probably saved thousands of households across the region from flooding. https://t.co/dpd1kyC2uL

Good to see @grantshapps committing to reverse Beeching rail closures. I launched a report from @the_tpa on opening up a whole series of local railway lines and services some months ago. Here is the report: https://t.co/sKX2EB6P6r

So far fewer flood victims than I had feared, but still miserable for those hit by the problem. Council think they have found every one, but if you have water ingress to your home call 01482 393939. They can help - from sandbags to housing to a range of items of advice. https://t.co/iAeeLkyece

Now Corbyn wants to nationalise broadband?  Sure we need more investment in broadband, but we also need more competent provision. Openreach is useless because it has too monopolistic a position. It needs more competition not less. State control will make it worse.
By the way, the village community in Everthorpe are amazing in how they turned out to help the residents who were flooded. Well done to all of them. https://t.co/357yKBNZWD
There appear to be floods elsewhere, but I won’t repeat until I am able to confirm. My heart goes out to those facing these floods - it’s always ever so grim in these situations.
The emergency services here in Haltemprice & Howden are working flat out but are facing a really tough situation. There’s a perfect storm of saturated ground, non-stop rain, full dykes and high tide.
The biblical rains continue. I’m currently at Everthorpe where some houses are beginning to flood. Cllr Victoria Aitken is already here - and the emergency services are doing a great job.

Checked out the water levels at one of the flood alert areas near me - Welham Bridge over the River Foulness. But this was before the hours of biblical rain we've had this afternoon... https://t.co/lT07J5xFre
.@LauraPidcockMP said on this morning’s @BBCr4today programme that immigrants were not to blame for wages being depressed. Quite right! It’s the policy’s fault - very much not the same thing.

Diabetes U.K. analysis shows obesity has almost doubled in the last 20 years. This trend could cripple the NHS in a generation, not to mention the misery it will cause through diabetes, heart disease, strokes, and cancer. See my article: https://t.co/MgArG0gugc
I would like to see more investment in initiatives like the Advanced Manufacturing Centre. https://t.co/meJZ8xcSHC
Excellent pledge by Boris to double r&d expenditure. We need to reverse the trend under all governments of the last 50 years. Just look at how we’ve been left behind: https://t.co/tj8WsSEhck
Good article from The Times on this here: https://t.co/Jd6OpO9zr3

Fantastic that Nottingham Trent are reviewing the number of 1st Class Honours they award. This grade inflation - and the notorious unconditional offers - were both encouraged by the terrible tuition fee/loan system. I will continue to campaign for its reform.

Donald Tusk is unwise to ignore the convention of staying out of internal politics of member states. Foreign leaders should stay out of our democratic decisions, whether they are Obama, Trump or Tusk.
@Marinosloizides Not sure just yet, certainly within the next couple of weeks. If you’d like to shoot me an email to campaign@daviddavis.uk, I’m happy to let you know!
Great work guys - I’m very lucky to have such a fantastic campaigning team! https://t.co/yjScI9bgQ1
And can’t forget the inevitable dog photo... https://t.co/CbciKHVHjv
Brilliant and sunny - if chilly - day on the campaign trail today with some of my team, visiting constituents in Howden and Gilberdyke. https://t.co/13oy4ZYOoS
Nice to see @Nigel_Farage is coming to my constituency, to the same place where I was readopted three months ago! He will find we’re all very welcoming in East Yorkshire. https://t.co/krFQCJ9681
Good news for democracy. The postal workers have every right to strike, but not when it would hold our democracy to ransom. https://t.co/QKhpKwpMYc

Good to see unemployment going down for the fastest quarterly rate in several years. 
https://t.co/xnhYFVE0Qo

.@john4brexit, the Brexit Party MEP, has a good piece on why Boris’ deal is a good one and can lead to a Canada+ outcome.
https://t.co/veHD5DwrXl

Lord Berkeley is right that it's been clear for a long time there has been a massive underestimate of the cost of HS2. It's ridiculous to suggest it should go ahead despite the spiralling cost. There are many other things the money could be spent on.
https://t.co/sKX2EB6P6r
Wrong decision again to carry on with HS2. It’s time to scrap this white elephant and invest in more useful local infrastructure, from rail to broadband. https://t.co/M0pOt6oG12
A tragedy that the last years of his life were blighted by the disgraceful Operation Midland. This makes it all the more important that we fix these weaknesses in our policing.
Very sad that the great and gallant Field Marshal Bramall has died. My condolences to his whole family for their loss - he was a very great man.
Cold, wet day on the streets, but reception still very good and we’ve found our mascot for the election! https://t.co/VhL3OX2V9j
Although there are bits of flooding around my constituency, we’ve thankfully not been hit as hard as elsewhere in the area. My thoughts go to those affected.
I think I also may have met half of Haltemprice and Howden’s canine population! https://t.co/8ODoethJKV
Some fantastic responses today from constituents on the success of our Transwaste appeal. My team and I enjoyed a great lunch at The Green Dragon in Welton. https://t.co/Y753YAB0YB
Away from politics, a great visit to a young entrepreneur @NFireLabs. A start-up company offering bespoke 3-D design and printing at an amazingly good price. https://t.co/yUmWm76Q72
Great morning campaigning. Response on the street has been excellent. Thankfully the weather has improved! https://t.co/YSSScOJz4u

The ISC report on any Russian influence in our democracy should be published. To not do so risks creating a paranoid vacuum that'll only damage the institutions we hold dear. I told the minister as much, earlier today. https://t.co/DrZ2pJtr1Y

The health and lives of British children in Syria are at risk if we wait any longer to bring them home.  I again asked the Foreign Secretary @DominicRaab to do just that. The Government must solve this problem before there is a fatality. https://t.co/58rBPOMyWv

Very significant that the @ICOnews says "police forces need to slow down and justify" the use of live facial recognition technology. I completely agree. It is time for Parliament to debate this.

https://t.co/PjWLyvLAng

The Government has taken a very progressive view on the use of genomics. But often the symptoms of genetic diseases do not manifest themselves until the developmental damage has been done. So today I urged@Jochurchill4 to look at genetic testing for all newborns in the future. https://t.co/SMbrfMXmvg

Interesting open minded response from @MattHancock on cannabis. This is a serious and urgent issue for children with intractable epilepsy. I think there is an argument for immediate controlled trials at a leading children's hospital @GreatOrmondSt. @Dr_PhilippaW
I welcome the Government's generous approach to child refugees in Europe. I hope they will show the same generosity to British child refugees in Syria. https://t.co/vi9r0R6OGK

This is particularly strange given the sugar tax is a major part of @DHSCgovuk's childhood obesity plan. 

https://t.co/1JgN5r8C30

Interesting to learn that @PHE_uk has not made an assessment of the impact of the sugar tax on consumption. 

https://t.co/PGgEuOh9Vg

The 60 British children caught in the violence in north-east Syria must be repatriated. If we to do nothing, we will see these children again. But it will not be as functioning members of society. It will be as our enemy on the battlefields of the future. 
https://t.co/L2oyNcOkTG
RT @lowcarbGP: In Westminster today with @DavidDavisMP discussing fatty liver and type 2 diabetes Also How starchy carbs are ‘soon to be su…
RT @CentralLobby: NEW: Police conduct towards investigative journalists seeking to expose the truth of what happened at the Loughinisland m…
Watch the full debate, here: https://t.co/5qYCWcFfSk

Here is the story of @Barry_TheDetail and @TrevorBirney - two journalists who were arrested for exposing incompetence and collusion in the investigation of the Loughinisland massacre, a brutal sectarian attack during the Northern Irish Troubles. https://t.co/VTM46ajntP
Great to see John Humphrys back in play. Might even see Classic FM listenership increase at expense of Radio 4! https://t.co/BRhEiN1ldm
.@michaelgove is absolutely correct - @SteveBakerHW did some brilliant work at DExEU, supported by some fantastic civil servants. https://t.co/21TrMbYgAt

Good luck to my former press SpAd @TEMSmith, who is running 3 marathons in 3 days. Clearly a year working on Brexit was not tough enough! He's raising money for a very good cause, @theCALMzone - https://t.co/Psp5XuAEH6
@AWMurrison Here is the response from @AWMurrison https://t.co/RPONjhk6yV

The geopolitical disaster in Syria has left at least 60 British children, there through no fault of their own, in need of the Government's help. Today I asked @AWMurrison not to abandon our moral obligations, and to repatriate these vulnerable children before it's too late. https://t.co/FiPvLhmsHL

Earlier today I asked @KellyTolhurst about executive pay. The Government thinks there is no link between the use of share buyback and executive underperformance. Maybe they should look at this @EY_Poland study - https://t.co/4OfhG99sUl https://t.co/4bboEIl4fU
.@EmmaHardyMP asked a good question about BAE Brough today. We are going to see the Minister, @annietrev, to discuss the issue on Wednesday.
Today I asked @MarkLancasterMK what the Ministry of Defence is doing to increase the recruitment of service personnel and to ensure they are fit for deployment. https://t.co/3bNuGFMjwO

During the referendum, Parliament effectively made a promise to the British people to deliver on their decision. Today is the day to deliver on that promise and vote the deal through. https://t.co/EkNdbZTRF0
I also spoke on @BBCr4today programme on Britain's trade opportunities after we leave the EU: https://t.co/34XycajsER

Here are my three criteria for an acceptable deal for Northern Ireland:
1. Do not break up the union
2. Equal Advantage for Northern Ireland when leaving the EU
3.Maintain democratic rights https://t.co/q3MLviZcwo

Victims of domestic violence experience terror and fear when their assailants are released from prison. Today I urge @patel4witham to look at extending restriction on those criminals, possibly for life, to better protect victims. https://t.co/MnANrica4K

Following my intervention on returning foreign fighters to face justice, and rescuing their families from becoming future terrorists, @Mark_J_Harper & @Jamie4North backed me up. The Foreign Secretary said he would take on board our concerns and keep the situation under review. https://t.co/xxgjcFGnRa

The escape of Daesh prisoners in northern Syria is a threat to western society. I urged @DominicRaab to work with colleagues to return terrorists and their families to face justice and ensure their children are not brought up in an environment which will turn them into terrorists https://t.co/pA9buBm9Tp
Harrowing piece on the recent suicides linked to the Loan Charge. This punitive retrospective tax must be scrapped. https://t.co/hR2pdffR0P
Here is my letter to @patel4witham https://t.co/OU0iMOWkAL

After the Chief Magistrate who issued search warrants in Operation Midland agreed with the Henriques report's criticism of the police, it looks inevitable there will have to be a criminal investigation of police conduct. I will write to the Home Secretary. https://t.co/uHJ8gGhPNI

When violent criminals are released it is a time of fear and sometimes terror for their victims. Today I asked @RobertBuckland what more can be done to protect victims beyond the licence period of their abusers. https://t.co/lMzILkE6r8
There is a growing impetus behind the restriction of both private and public use of facial recognition cameras in US towns. https://t.co/wThwoKbPwg

The UK’s constitution has worked for hundreds of years but faced with a number of challenges, including Brexit, it is close to failure. We now need a full-scale written constitution to rebalance our nation’s decision-making.
https://t.co/TzUSrtHtG4

The tragedy of the Loan Charge is that seven people have taken their own lives because of the pressure and stress caused. If Ministers do not end the use of this punitive retrospective taxation, the Commons will force it to. https://t.co/qW2kk0LK5k
Finally, investment in hospitals is excellent, and it should be publicly financed - NOT through PFI. This is possible when interests rates are so low.
The investment in "on demand" bus services is good. This could be fantastic for low-density rural areas.
.@SajidJavid is right - infrastructure investment IS key to Britain's future success. Investment in extending high-speed broadband to the most remote areas of the country is long overdue.

Absolute pleasure to speak with @GaryGibbonBlog and @CarolineFlintMP about the recent Brexit developments. Watch the full recording here. https://t.co/v0ewokWh69

It is important that we now act to find a solution that is politically acceptable to the Irish Government. The EU is likely to hold the line for a while. It's time for Parliament, too, to hold its nerve.
The key point in last night's vote is the dramatic turnaround, from a defeat by 230 votes to a win by 16. This shows support for a complete revision of the Backstop and a good free trade agreement.
Historic night last night as @TulipSiddiq becomes the first MP to cast a proxy vote. An important and long overdue reform which will improve our Parliament. Congratulations Tulip.
